name: James Hoffmann Chemex recipe
short_description: Chemex recipe by James Hoffmann, winner of World barista Championship, YouTuber, coffee consultant, and author. For Chemex James recommeds almost the same technique as for V60. [Watch the tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikt-X5x7yoc).

steps.description: Grind the beans, boil the water. Put the paper filter into the Chemex (3 folds towards the spout). Rinse filter with boiling water, dump the water. Add grounds, make a divot in the middle. Place on scale and zero it out.
Add (2 x <final_coffee_amount>)- (3 x <final_coffee_amount>)g. of water
Stir to wet all the grounds, let it bloom
Add water in a circular motion, breaking up any clumps until you reach (0.6 x <final_water_amount>)g.
Continue to add water until you reach <final_water_amount>)g.
Use a spoon to give a good stir clockwise, and then another counter clockwise
Give the chemex a little shake.
Wait until drawdown completes.
Grind the coffee, heat water, fold the paper filter and insert it into Chemex, rinse the Filter and Carafe, add coffee grounds.
Pre-wet with (2 x <final_coffee_amount>)g of water. Pour slowly in a spiral pattern, starting from the center and working your way outwards.
Let the coffee bloom.
Pour in concentric circles until your water level reaches the top of the Chemex.
Wait for the coffee grounds to return back down to about their original level
Repeat the same process for additional full immersion pours until you reach <final_water_amount>g of water. Wait for the complete drawdown.
Grind the coffee, heat water, fold the paper filter and insert it into Chemex, rinse the Filter and Carafe, add coffee grounds.
Pre-wet with about (2 x <final_coffee_amount>)g of water. Pour just enough water over the grounds to cover and saturate them.
Let the coffee bloom.
Add (0.21 x <final_water_amount>)g. water, pouring in a slow, circular motion.
Wait.
Now add more water, until the scale reads (0.64 x <final_water_amount>)g.
Wait 2 minutes.
Add water until you reach<final_water_amount>g. and wait for the complete drawdown.
